thread.section_title: North Texas Mean Green News - Sports News for Dallas, Texas
thread.title: Former North Texas LB Zach Orr calls out alma mater for poor performance, says team 'might as well end' its season
thread.title_full: Former North Texas LB Zach Orr calls out alma mater for poor performance, says team 'might as well end' its season | Dallas Morning News

author: Joshua Friemel
title: Former North Texas LB Zach Orr calls out alma mater for poor performance, says team 'might as well end' its season
text:
Zach Orr, one of the best linebackers in recent North Texas history, isn't happy with his alma mater.
After the Mean Green fired head coach Dan McCarney , Orr took to Twitter to air his frustrations.
All the UNT players need to get off Twitter foreal y'all embarrassing yourselves the way you fix things is fix it on the field not talking
â” Zachary Orr (@ZO35) October 11, 2015 Before sending the above tweet, Orr tweeted the following about the teams' 66-7 loss to Portland State.
They might as well end their season tonight in Denton what's the point they don't want to play anymore it's sad @BC_3 @mpr_drbone2
â” Zachary Orr (@ZO35) October 10, 2015 Here's some other reaction from some UNT athletes, as well as others from media members, fans and more.
Listen.. it's up to our players to take ownership and step their preparation and game up, period! This team needs maturity and leadership
â” james hamilton (@mpr_drbone2) October 11, 2015 No need to cry and whine like babies, go get to work! Forget the fans, forget the front office, the students.. it's on yall as players now
â” james hamilton (@mpr_drbone2) October 11, 2015 I was there when dodge got let go. We had to begin to train each other the proper way to win and that's by being together and playing victim
â” james hamilton (@mpr_drbone2) October 11, 2015 I promise yall brighter days will come and take your frustrations and convert it into a passion to be the winner you came here to be #MGF
â” james hamilton (@mpr_drbone2) October 11, 2015 Coach Mac believed in me & gave me a chance to be great at North Texas. For that, I am forever grateful #GoMeanGreen pic.twitter.com/PU2Jzxh3nb
â” Marcus Trice (@BeGreatEight) October 11, 2015 Thanks to Coach Mac for giving me an amazing opportunity that no other coach would have done. That's my family right there.
â” Daniel Khan (@danielkhan81) October 11, 2015 Just wanna thank coach Mac for every blessing he has given me and my family!
â” Calvin Minor (@Minor_is_Major) October 11, 2015 if you have UNT in your bio and you're on here clowning our team, shut up. They're the face of our school, they represent you too..
â” SAUCE 0â£8â£ (@chelsauce08) October 11, 2015 Can somebody explain to me why North Texasâ™ AD felt need to do this immediately after the game? The guys were still in locker room #BadForm
â” FootballScoop Staff (@FootballScoop) October 11, 2015 Sorry to hear that North Texas fired football coach Dan McCarney today. Dan's an awesome guy who will land on his feet.
â” Pat Doney (@PatDoneyNBC5) October 11, 2015 4th head coach in 5 years. I guess I'm pretty cultured in college football.
â” trey keenan (@TreyKeenan) October 11, 2015 here's hoping Bob Stoops stops by Denton and picks up his good friend Dan McCarney on his way back to Norman.
â” Bill Jones (@CBS11BillJones) October 11, 2015 Too bad Dan McCarney couldn't make it work at #UNT . Good guy, but losing to FCS Portland St 66-7 speaks volumes. https://t.co/HCx5Xlq18i
â” Joe Trahan (@JoeTrahan) October 11, 2015 Football can be a cruel business. UNT messed up its own football schedule, Dan McCarney starts 0-5 and takes the fall.
â” Edward Egros (@EdwardEgrosFox4) October 11, 2015 On Twitter:
 @Josh_Friemel
